poem:
### Edge of Air

In Poland's sky,  
silver-winged shadows dance—  
an unsettling  
arabesque of tension,  
metal birds trespass  
by design.  
Below,  
the earth listens  
for signals  
in the whirring silence,  
hearts clasped like  
the quiet before  
thunder  
as the world,  
tethered  
to threads of sky,  
waits—  
breathless.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Drones in Poland are another unsettling post-Alaska escalation by Russia Whatever Donald Trump discussed with Vladimir Putin in Alaska last month, the outcome has only been a stepped increase in Russian aggression that has now forced Nato’s military forces into action. On Tuesday night 19 Russian drones entered the country’s airspace, according to the prime minister, Donald Tusk – a number that cannot be easily explained away as accidental.
